definitions.definition: A generalization of a triangle or tetrahedron to an arbitrary dimension , the generalization being the simplest possible convex polytope for a given dimension; more accurately , the convex hull of n + 1 {\displaystyle n+1} affinely independent points in n {\displaystyle n} - dimensional space .

subdefinitions.definition: A word which is not compound and contains no derivational affixes ( inflectional affixes are usually disregarded ); a monomorphemic word.
examples: The word weak is a simplex . Its derivative weaken is not.

subdefinitions.definition: In full simplex sentence : in transformational grammar : a simple sentence which is the product of a few transformations ; a kernel sentence.

definitions.definition: An apartment (or, sometimes, another type of property ) having only one floor or storey ; a single-storey property.

main_definition: ( algebraic topology , geometry ) A generalization of a triangle or tetrahedron to an arbitrary dimension , the generalization being the simplest possible convex polytope for a given dimension; more accurately , the convex hull of n + 1 {\displaystyle n+1} affinely independent points in n {\displaystyle n} - dimensional space .
secondary_definitions: ( originally and chiefly US ) An apartment (or, sometimes, another type of property ) having only one floor or storey ; a single-storey property.
